content.webTitle: Pick of the week: Central: Exhibitions

fields.headline: Pick of the week: Exhibitions
fields.bodyText: Thomas Bewick, John Wood And Paul Harrison Ikon Gallery, Birmingham Bewick's humorous vignette engravings, plus Wood & Harrison present their video theatre of absurdities and futilities. David Ward Kettle's Yard, Cambridge Deceptively simple surfaces are aﬀorded a contemplative and almost numinous depth through Ward's enchanted lens. Art through which to wonder. James Lee Byars Milton Keynes Gallery Byars, a visionary sculptor, dandiﬁed showman and performance trickster, created work that is both mischievously humorous and deeply serious. Fatal Attraction Compton Verney A historical array of art relating to the myth of Diana and Actaeon and "the fatal gaze". Includes Picasso, Schiele and Mapplethorpe's dangerous glimpses. The Golden Record: Sounds Of The Earth The Collection, Lincoln Over 130 artists oﬀer an ironic retake on and relaunch of the original 1977 Voyager Space Mission cultural time capsule.
